plants.name: Chamaecyparis pisifera 'Boulevard'
plants.notes: Aphids, honey fungus, phytophthora root disease

plants.name: Prunus incisa 'Kojo-no-mai'
plants.notes: Aphids, caterpillars and bullfinches. Silver leaf, honey fungus, blossom wilt and Taphrina wiesneri.

plants.name: Sambucus racemosa 'Sutherland Gold'
plants.notes: Thrives on v. chalky sites. Blackfly / Red spider mite / Verticillium wilt

plants.name: Juniperus x pfizeriana 'Carbery Gold'
plants.notes: Aphids, juniper scale insects and caterpillars

plants.name: Pieris Japonica 'Carnaval'
plants.notes: Pieris lacebug, leaf spot and phytophthora root diseases

plants.name: Acer palmatum 'Marlo'
plants.notes: Aphids, scale insects, coral spot, verticillium wilt

plants.name: Fatsia japonica 'Spider's Web'
plants.notes: White flowers followed by black berries

plants.name: Aucuba japonica variegata
plants.notes: Small purple flowers followed by red berries if male nearby

plants.name: Nandina domestica
plants.notes: Star shaped white flower pannicles followed by red berries

plants.name: Dryopertis Erythorosora 'Brilliance'
plants.notes: Easy to grow in most cool, moist, lightly shaded sites and will grow in full sun if given plenty of moisture. Tolerant of dry shade but water regularly in their first season and mulch well

plants.name: Liquidambar styraciflua
plants.notes: Grow in lime-free soil in sun or partial shade. Suitable for woodlands

plants.name: Wisteria frutescens 'Amethyst Falls'
plants.notes: Prune in July and February every year. During the first two years, prune to create a framework of permanent stems. Tie in selected lateral shoots and cut back unwanted growth. In Autumn or Spring, apply a mulch of well-rotted manure or compost to the base of the plant.

plants.name: Chamaedorea radicalis
plants.notes:
A cold hardy palm species originating from altitude in Mexico.
This attractive plant develops deep green and tough pinnate leaves, and reliably flowers when mature. Very much an understory palm, Chamaedorea radicalis requires a shaded spot to thrive, where it can be deceptively tough and tolerate lows down to -6 to -8. Plant in any good quality humus rich soil.

plants.name: Trachycarpus fortunei x nanus
plants.notes: One for the collector! This is an unusual cross between Trachycarpus fortunei and the rarely encountered Trachycarpus nanus. Both palm species are hardy in the UK, and the cross will undoubtedly produce a most interesting and hardy palm.
